meanings.definition: Industrialisms: Characteristics or practices of industrialization.
meanings.sent1: The industrialisms of the factory included assembly lines and machinery.
meanings.sent2: In the city, you can see the industrialisms of modern buildings and factories.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to imitate the industrialisms of the factory workers, but it just made a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of industrialisms, constantly thinking of ways to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The industrialisms of the past shaped the world we live in today.

meanings.definition: Industrialisms: Phrases or expressions commonly used in industrial settings.
meanings.sent1: Workers in the factory often use specific industrialisms like 'assembly line' and 'quality control'.
meanings.sent2: Learning the industrialisms of the trade helped him communicate effectively with his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The new employee was confused by the industrialisms used by the experienced workers.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was filled with industrialisms, making it clear she was familiar with the industry.
meanings.sent5: He studied the industrialisms of the manual, trying to understand the technical terms.
